As  you  know this  is  one  of  the  nice  MOTEL6  in   the  area.  In   future  if   you   are    coming  this   area,  Please  give  us  opportunity    to   serve. I   will  make   sure  you  have   a  happy   stay.  Once   again   thanks.  Mac   Hossain. GM@MOTEL6NEWPORTBEACH>COM

Summary: We stayed in the hotel for just one night in our way up to Santa Monica from San Diego. The rooms were clean and very spacious - for the amount we paid I was very impressed. It's not that close to Newport but was a short taxi ride to get there which was fine. The staff were extremely helpful. We really enjoyed our stay here and it's well worth the small amount of money you pay!

Upgraded our room for free, HUGE room, super clean, basic but brilliant! Comfortable nights sleep in a spotless environment. The staff and manager were super friendly, we had a great stay and felt very welcome. I can't recommend the place enough! Best wishes from the UK!

Summary Heading: Wow! I really liked this Motel 6!
Summary: I haven't stayed in Motel Six for over 40 years. I really loved the modern touches of the motel. I have two complaints: The bath towels were extremely rough not soft.(They were however clean.) The outside noise from other guests came right through the room. Loved the directtv, the firm and modern bed and the large room size. Staff was very nice and helpful as well.

Comfy spacious room, with fairly working WiFi and a huge TV. Noisy, even if you get a room to the inside. Very clean and everything was working properly. Felt safer than most of the motels. No breakfast and hard to find a place around with a decent breakfast.

Summary Heading: A million times better than we ever thought we would get at a motel
Summary: We arrived at motel six thinking we'd get a room a shower, some cockroaches and a parking space and that'd be it... We were very wrong.. We got the friendliest staff we could ask for, a huge room with a king sized bed and a large bathroom and a parking space. The hotel (better than motel style rooms) was in walking distance of two 'dive bars' which is where the locals go and an excellent pizzeria, a little bit further walking and you can get to triangle square (strange oxymoron I know) where there are a lot of sports bars and restaurants (more pricey than the dive bars and pizzeria) these were nice and we spent a while there during our stay. This motel was an excellent base the only minor issue was having to stay on one side of the room for the wifi to work but that was no big

My boyfriend and I stayed here in November and on arrival, we were upgraded to a king size room free of charge. The room was big, clean and had a fridge/freezer, microwave, flat screen tv & plenty of sockets to plug in electrical devices. The car park was free and there were always plenty of spaces to choose from. There was also a small pool and seating area around it. The room was cleaned every day & in the 5 nights we stayed there, it was spotless.  The staff were extremely helpful and accommodating. They lent us an iron free of charge, gave us plenty of information about the area and also called the Hollywood Motel 6 on our behalf to reserve a parking space, as we were travelling there a few days later. They also gave us their business card and the name of the Hollywood Motel

We encountered very friendly staff at this motel. Our room was nicely designed, clean and not very noisy. The beds were comfortable and WiFi worked. The price for the night was reasonable. Nothing to complain, I would visit this motel anytime again.

I had the chance to stay at Motel 6 with my wife for almost 2 weeks and we were very impressed with the quality of their services for the price they charged.  The room was very big, comfortable and clean. The AC was very good, we had a fridge, a microwave and there were no issues with noises at all. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was cleaned every day. The wi-fi was very fast and stable. Also, differently from what I saw in many reviews here on TripAdvisor, I had no trouble at all to park. We arrived at the hotel at different times during the day and always had plenty of parking options.  The location is also good if you're driving a car. It is close to the main freeways and is a few miles away from the beach and cities like Irvine, Santa Ana and Anaheim.  I
Manager Response: Thanks  for   staying  with  us.  We  appreciated  for  your  business.  Plse  feel  free  to  call  us  Or  email  for   future resv  we  will    give  our  best   efforts to   accomodate  you.  Thanks Mac Hossain gm@motel6newportbeach.com.

Summary Heading: No frills, inexpensive place in a decent neighborhood
Summary: As far as Motel 6 goes, if you can find one like this, that's been remodeled, they're pretty nice. They have a funky European dorm feel with platform beds, basic parquet flooring and minimal furniture. They're also very dog friendly. I know some reviews say the area is somewhat sketchy but I would disagree. If you get off the main boulevard, behind the hotel is a nice residential area that was perfect for walking my dog. The hotel is right off the Costa Mesa freeway so could be loud but we had a room at the back of the property so it was pretty quiet. Also, Napa Valley Pizza & Pasta right next door is VERY good. We ate there twice during our stay. The hotel is also very convenient to John Wayne Airport.

The room was updated, pool was nice and clean, hot tub relaxing. Area is somewhat sketchy, but close to freeway for easy convenience. The owner was nice, until it was time to check out and did not want anyone hanging around past check-out time.

Rooms were very nice Baki at front desk extremly nice as well as knowlegeable of hotel.  Rooms were clean I just had an issue that when housekeeping serviced your room they trash behind and didnt supply your towels back. I had to go to front desk to get them. Other than that I have no complaints. I would stay here again

Summary Heading: Inexpensive place to rest our heads
Summary: We've stayed here twice now for DR appointments. At the end of August & the beginning of September. We had enough clean towels. Sure it can be noisey as the windows are not double paned. It's nice to have coffee & danish in the morning.  I did leave a necklace my 2nd visit & they called about it. Hopefully it will still be around when/if we return! Make sure you bring Everything else you need as there are NO extras here. Phone did not work at all & wasn't replaced or repaired by next visit either. Cable guide was outdated by 2nd stay. Pillows were on the small flimsy side. Paper machine outside didn't work properly causing several lost coins. They could have done better about outside upkeep; cig butts, matches & trash.

You get what you pay for. A clean bed and a bathroom with towels. Do not expect anything else or you will be dissapointed (I was). The rooms are dark, incredibly noisy, you can hear every air conditioning, everybody´s showers, pipes, conversations from next room. Enough parking, covered and open air. carrying a heavy bag to the upper floor? Not good. It was supposed to be my "operation base" for three nights to explore the area: Newport, Disney and L.A. Do not think that is possible: traffic is crazy and distances are much larger than it seems. It´situated near newport (20 minutes or so) and it can work for Annaheim (35-40 minutes) but no way for L.A. I only expended there the first night, then I left, rented another hotels, paid more and had a much nicer experience.
Manager Response: Lauramgr, Thank you for taking the time to share your review. We sincerely apologize for your unpleasant stay. We invite you to contact our Guest Relations department at 1-855-787-9864 to record any details of your visit to help us provide a better guest experience in the future.

Summary: Check in was quick and easy especially considering I arrived around 11 PM, switched from a non-smoking to a smoking room free of charge, room was clean as well as bathroom.  The HDMI port under the TV was broken and there were 2 small burn holes in the comforter which was to be expected.  Also there is a closet but no dresser or nightstand to store your belongings. Located on a one way road so that can get annoying at times.  Grocery store, Liqour store, Donut shop and a Circle K are all within walking distance. Very close to John Wayne airport.

It's a nice and cheap motel. Very well positioned: few miles from Disneyland, Huntington, laguna beach and beaches. Rooms are clean. Parking is open air or covered. Nice and professional staff. The only problem is that there's no hair dryer in the rooms.

Summary Heading: Shame on everyone that gave place a good rating
Summary: I checked in and immediately turned around. This place was a crack house for hookers and low lives. Please do not go to this place,I really was scared. The room looked like a jail cell. Do not believe any other review. I would challenge anyone to disagree with assessment.

We needed a place to stay for a friends birthday bash in Newport Beach. The price couldn't be beat for the location and quality of this motel. Close enough the the bars... Our Uber ride was only $12 to get to Baja Sharkeez. The modern bright decor and "wood" floors is a nice change from the usual drab, icky, gag-inducing comforters and carpet of most motels. I had no idea that the rooms had a mini fridge with a microwave (plus a snack machine around the way). What a nice surprise! They only have enough parking space for 1 car per room (especially when fully booked) but additional cars can park literally around the corner. No parking restrictions. The staff was very pleasant upon check-in and also kind when they had to tell us to quiet down at 3:00 am (so sorry!). This place is

This is the budget travellers option and for the $60 USD we paid it was well worth it. We had a great welcome for the front reception and were even given a free car park for our stay ($60 value). Free tea and coffee in the morning and central to the freeway if you have a car. We would stay here again.

Had to go to a convention in Irvine, this was close and much cheaper than the convention hotel.  Easy check in, easy parking, clean, very large room.  Microwave and fridge.  Plan to go to same convention next year and will stay at this location.

Summary Heading: Can't beat it for the price.
Summary: We stayed for 3 nights and was satisfied with our room for the price we paid. Easy access right next to freeway which sound wise was not a problem for us at all. The hallway could have been cleaned a little better but the room was clean. Daughter was a little concerned about "sketchy" area but once in room was comfortable. The front desk was very nice and when we requested an extra pillow gave us one immediately. Did not use the pool because by time we returned from our activities it was closed. Front desk informed me on check in it closed at 9:30. They do not have any breakfast items but I'm ok about that for price. Plenty of places in area to eat. Could have used a couple more towels but not a deal breaker. For only $60 this was a deal with such a close proximity to the beach

A no frills budget friendly one nighter for when you are on the road. Don't expect much of a welcome from the manager or if you are from overseas to be able to pay with a travel card. Rooms are fine, basic but adequate. Not really anymore you can say.

A friend & I stayed in room 120 from 4/30-5/6/14 at a cost of $421.  Pros: Clean spacious rooms with 2 double beds, good closet size, good size fridge, no noise, no nasty carpets as it has wood floors, felt safe at this location, close to freeway, 24 donut shop next door.. Cons:  there are no dressers to put your clothes in,  the SHARP TV was horrible as all shows looked like bad bootleg movies, towels were limited and were VERY small and rough to the skin, toilet didnt flush so good, Wifi was not very consistent. rooms do not have hair dryers but the front desk will loan you one if you bring it right back (we kept ours all week), parking can be challenging if you get in late, you will have to park further away and walk to room, the printer in the lobby was not working during

Motel 6 allowed easy access to Newport beach and local amenities. The friendly and knowledgable staff member behind the desk gave us advice on where to go eat and we got a free room upgrade. The room was sizeable and clean - got a decent nights sleep and enjoyed the free morning coffee; refreshed ready to hit the beach.

This was our last stop on our 14 night trip around the Usa. We arrived quite tired and were checked in quite quickly, loads of free parking so no problem there, lifts up to the rooms. The room was huge with two double beds perfect for a family of four. However why do motels/hotels only ever give you one flat pillow and a tiny towel each?? v annoying! Perfect base for us as we were out all the time, had no problems would stay in a motel 6 again

Hotel was recently remodeled and exceeded expectations for motel 6. Staff was accommodating and friendly. Only complaint would be noisey because the walls between the rooms are poorly sound insulated.  We will come back to this motel 6 it is a good value and pet friendly

The rooms are nice but the staff is absolutely terrible.  They treat you like you are an inmate and will act like they are owed something for letting you stay there.  Too bad the rooms got upgraded but the staff was not.  I will never ever stay there again.

Check in was easy but clark was not very friendly. It was late so just hitting the sack for the night was important. The room was like an echo chamber. Vinyl floors were peeling up, internet did NOT work, very noisy neighbours on all sides. The bed was comfy. No clock radio, poor lighting, Bed light did not work, bath nice but spartan. Noisy all night. Woken up several times, even with ear plugs. Won't do that again.

This time, I would like to share my recent experience in staying at Motel 6 Newport Beach in December 2013. I chose this motel because of its (good) reviews and the fact that it was on the way to San Diego. Upon my arrival in LAX, I spent few hours visiting few places in Orange County area before heading to this motel.  Later that evening, we both decided to to to Motel 6 after having our diner and check-in. It took us a little while before we found the motel although I used GPS to navigate us. We arrived and checked-in around 11:00 pm and when we arrived, we could see the outdoor parking lot was fully occupied so we had no hope in finding a room in the street level as we had requested.  We got our room upstairs in the back building. Our room was quite modern but in my opinion,

Summary Heading: Best Bang for the Buck and Pet Friendly!
Summary: So we were there for 10 days, it is our 2nd stay at this hotel. We remember having a great experience with this place so we came back. It is very reasonable for the price. Nothing fancy, but you have a clean room. There is TV (we were watching Big Bang Theory all the time) and also a refrigerator and microwave. Don't forget to bring your own soap, shampoo, dental paste, and tissue box. We did use the heater a bit because it was a bit chilly at night. We also brought our 2 little poochies. No extra charge. It was very convenient since it was next to a highway and also free self parking. Most of the time, we did not get stuck in traffic, which is great. There is also free wi-fi. We did use it all the time, it was a bit slow though. We were in room 305 and it was pretty noisy

I stayed here for one night before the Surf City Marathon.Room was clean. Very basic , but clean.  There was free WIFI, but slow and would disconnect many times. The room was good for the price especially since I just needed close place to crash before the race.If you're looking for a cheap place to stay this may be the place for you.

Room 403 is tiny but surprisingly quiet, considering it is directly above the office and right out on the main street.  I could hear people knocking on the door of the adjacent rooms early in the morning, but I was awake already.  Didn't use the WiFi.  I would say this property is about in the 40th percentile of Motel 6's.  Accor runs a decent hotel chain.

It's what you would expect from a Motel 6...not too much. A very basic motel. Bring your own shampoo and hair dryer as the only thing they provide is bar soap and towels. There wasn't even any tissues. According to the other reviews, the back rooms are quieter. I wouldn't know. I had a room up front, and you can definitely hear the traffic going by. The walls are thin and the area looked rather suspect, but nobody broke into my car or anything. The wi-fi was annoying because you had to reconnect to it about every 5 minutes. The bed was extremely uncomfortable. Good place to stay if you're just looking for some place cheap.

Summary Heading: Adequate for the price and area
Summary: Clean, spacious, with comfortable bed. Room recently painted, in good repair.  No extras, very basic but adequate. Room did have a refrigerator and a table with 2 chairs. WIFI was a pain and slow. We had to constantly log in because every time a device went to sleep, we would get logged out. Barely adequate to pick up email but not much more. Nonsmoking motel, a plus. The light was out around the TV unit and was fixed promptly the next day. Bring your own hair dryer or ask at the office for one as none in the room (hair dryer was clogged at the end and hadn't been cleaned, even when asked; they stared at me like they didn't know why or how to do it; we had to clean the lint ourselves to get more power). If you need a cheap place to stay and don't expect to spend time in the

Summary Heading: They Will Leave The Light On For You
Summary: Exactly what you would expect for a Motel 6.  Cheap and affordable. Families make it pretty loud.  The thin walls mean you hear everything.  Plan on brining your own soap, towels and pillows, unless you can make do with the absolute basics.  An honest motel a few miles from the beach that is good for families.

Very well ocated, this remodelled Hotel 6 is very good. The ambiance is very modern and by changing the carpets to solid floors, they have given a good step towards cleaner, healthier hotel rooms. The beds are very confortable, wi-fi works great, service was amiable. Very good hotel indeed.
Manager Response: Dear Rgkattan, Thank you for your recent stay with us! We are glad you enjoyed the new rooms. Hope to see you again soon. Safe Travels!

Summary Heading: Extended Stay Visit and it's exactly what I expected...
Summary: And that's because I took the time to really read everyone's reviews and it is just that - a nice, basic hotel.  Down in the area for an extended 8 day trip - trying to save some money for this unexpected trip.  I travel for work and am in hotels 3-5 nights a month so I knew this was going to be an experience because of the price.  I was staying alone for this period of time too so safety was a concern.  Please read if you want a real objective truth.  Check In - Mack was so friendly and helped me get an even cheaper rate than I booked on-line. He let me go look at the room before I signed on the dotted line to ensure I felt safe.  Room TIP: If you want the quietest rooms, ask for the rooms above the underground parking lot that's inside the buildings.  The doors to these few

Summary Heading: Surprisingly modern at a great price
Summary: Surprisingly modern, clean and friendly.  Great location not too far from the beach. Free parking and free wi-fi.  I wasn't expecting much, and was very pleasantly surprised with this motel.  I would definitely recommend it for a short stay (1 or 2 nights) when you're not looking for an expensive luxurious location but rather a modern, clean stop for an overnight.  If you're spending all day at the beach, or shopping at fashion island, you won't be in the room much anyway, and when you are, you will be comfortable enough for a great low price.

i had a queen room and it was very clean and nicely decorated. Personally i love minimalist theme so i found it very nice.  the room has a small fridge and microwave so it was convenient, the bathroom was clean, hot shower was working well and there was a bathtub! i didn't expect that!  a lot of reviews said that the walls are really thin but i didn't feel it as a problem.  In addition, the manager and staffs were really nice and helpful.  definitely a good deal for the price i paid. really recommended!

Summary Heading: Beyond CHEAP--You'll Pay Way Too Much For Way Too Little!!!  HUGE DISAPPONTMENT, even for a Motel 6!!!
Summary: If you're looking for a CHEAP, very basic, no frills place to stay next to a freeway, within a 2-3 mile drive to Newport Beach, then this is the place for you.  The hotel has very sparse (they call "modern") furnishings--it reminded me more of a hostel.  We paid for a Queen size bed, but it was barely a Full size and the mattress was very hard. There was a tiny table screwed into the wall with 2 hard wooden chairs.  No dresser, had to keep my clothes in my suitcase on the floor & only 4 hangers in a tiny alcove for the closet.  The walls are paper thin, we could hear everything next door.  No carpet on the floor--had to wear flip-flops because the bottom of my feet turned black on the wooden floor.  The phone never worked,  nor was fixed the entire week we stayed there,  even
Manager Response: Dear Nanniebella, Thank you for taking the time to post your review. The cleanliness and maintenance issues you encountered are not consistent with our standards for quality at Motel 6, and we sincerely apologize for your unpleasant stay. Please kindly contact our guest relations department so they can have a record of your experience to help us provide our guests with better service in the future: 1-800-577-3435.

Summary: Stopped here when travelling with a friend past newport beach/huntington beach area. The motel was very good! Rooms were clean and very modern, beds actually fairly comfortable (for motels!). Staff were very helpful, we used the laundry machines whilst there too and also worked and cleaned fine. There is lots of space and pool was quite nice too, although slightly dirty in places this didn't really bother us. Overall this place is great value for a motel! Would definitely recommend.

Summary Heading: A good place for a clean room and good location.
Summary: We were in town for a funeral and it was near the church and the family home, with a little work on my part, like taking a hot pot so we could make coffee, plus our own cups and soft drinks. I must say the bed was very comfortable, and the AC was quiet , sleeping was great!

Summary Heading: Just what we were looking for.
Summary: We wanted a clean, comfortable, affordable place to stay in Costa Mesa for a couple of nights and this place fit the bill exactly! Rooms are minimalistic but big, beds are comfortable and the bathroom spacious and practical. There is only a simple coat rack to hang some clothes; I would have liked a chest with drawers to put some things away. Now, I kept most of my things in the suitcase on the floor, which was just OK. We asked for a room at the 3rd floor in the back, so we had no noise from the highway. But indeed the walls are paper thin. Our neighbor came to ask if we could turn the TV down a bit, because they had to get up early in the morning. So, be mindful of your neighbors with noise!  Parking was convenient; because of the subterranean garage, our car was always cool.

Summary Heading: Large rooms, very clean, convenient location
Summary: Wow, I was SHOCKED at how great this place was. The room was huge (we had enough room for our blow up bed on the floor), I stayed there alone with my two sons and felt safe in this location, in spite of its freeway proximity. It is very close to Huntington Beach, only about 10 minutes, which is why I chose it. Also very conveniently located near any kind of shopping/restaurants you might want. The only problems: Our fridge didn't work (we had a cooler, I just kept filling it with ice from their ice maker, I didn't even tell them about it until the night before we were leaving and, to their credit, they came up right away and tried to fix it), and, bizarrely, when I went to do laundry, they have no quarters on hand! The guy in the office told me to go to the liquor store on the

My first time at a Motel 6. I booked based on good reviews as I looked for a simple place to spend a couple nights. From check-in on, my experience was perfect. I could tell immediately that my room was super clean, plus the grounds and pool were as well. WiFi worked perfectly, so did TV, frig, microwave and the key cards. Not one single problem. Pure pleasure, I was in and out in no time, slept really good, felt completely safe... and was close to everything. The staff is super-friendly. All around highly recommended.   I did know that there will be no coffeemaker or shampoo/conditioner, so I came prepared. In all honesty, I'll take a clean and friendly place as this motel 6 without coffeemaker & shampoo over an unclean one with those things any time.

Summary Heading: very clean, but a couple problems
Summary: the room wasn't a typical motel 6, it was very modern looking, clean good service. i was very surprised on how clean  the rooms were. However we ran into a couple problems. 1. We encountered many extremely slow internet connections during our 3 day stay. 2. Our room key did not work a total of two times and that means we had to walk all the way to the front office (which was quite a ways from our room) 3. the walls are paper thin and can hear people outside. If motel 6 fixes their internet problems and making sure room key works i will come back but i won't be coming back for a while.

First of all, remember this is a Motel 6, so do not judge it or expect it to be something it isn't. No amenities - but good price :)  This particular Motel 6 is very clean, very comfortable, newly remodeled.  The person (I believe may be the manager) who helped me a couple of times pre-trip and was also there to check us in the afternoon of arrival, was extremely helpful and pleasant on the phone and was very friendly when we checked in.  Immediately offered anything we might need in the way of extra towels etc. We did not find any needs and our requests were all met pre-arrival.  It is also nice that this Motel 6 has fridge and microwave. The TV screen was good size and the beds were very comfortable. The traveler pics on this site look very true to life. The floor is not

Newly refurbed motel, about $10 dollar taxi ride into Newport beach area. Had to ask for more pillows. The fixtures and fitting are above standard for motel 6, overall a good base. For a great dinner try the blue water grill in Newport.

Summary Heading: Good value for money, very clean hotel!
Summary: Within a short driving distance to Newport Beach. Very clean room with fridge and microwave. Great value for money. Free wifi and parking. All staff were extremely friendly and helpful. I would recommend this hotel if staying for a few nights in the Newport Beach area.

Summary Heading: Wow I was surprised how nice & clean the room was! Loved it!
Summary: The rooms are amazing! Modern & clean! Love the colors! Great parking & very nice people working! I would totally stay here again next time I visit Costa Mesa. It's close to the beach & all the restaurants. Great location! Loved it!

The property is located in a nice area. The rooms have been updated and seem more modern. I will say that its obvious that the work was done with limited funds by a cheap contractor, but at least they are trying. The price was the main reason I chose to stay there and I had low expectations. They exceeded those expectations and I will likely stay there again. The walls are paper thin, and as a result in the morning you can hear everything happening next door and outside. Luckily I had to wake up early.

Great price! This was a super short hotel stay for me - arrived in the middle of the night and left around 11am. The bed was super comfortable. The room was neat and tidy. The shower was average - was one of those tiny shower heads which shoots into your body not above your head.   Free WIFI and space to park.  So close to the airport which was the reason for our stay. I'd stay here again.

Didn't really know to expect when I booked this motel when I arrived I pleasantly surprised. Checking in went smoothly and we were upgraded to one of their newer 'European' style rooms which was clean and well maintained.  The front desk manager Moe was very friendly and called in to check on us after we settled in to make sure that the room was up to far and that we didn't need anything else.  I had booked 4 days, but I had to cut my trip short and leave early. Moe was extremely helpful and told me that he would refund me the unused days and within a couple of mins everything was taken care of.  Great service from my personal experience, clean rooms, and close to 405 so you have easy access to the freeways.

I was slightly nervous when we booked this room because i have had bad experiances with Motel 6 before. We were traveling with 2 dogs, and this wasn't too far from the beach and the price was great. We stayed 3 nights. When we checked in they weren't really friendly at all. Which was disappointing. Our room was on the first floor next to the pool; the pool was small but clean and well kept. Our room was just redone and it was lovely. Very modern rooms, fresh paint and new beds. Loved to room, the floors were wood lamniate which was nice with the dogs. The room as a whole was clean and neat. The room was big which was nice as we had a place to put the dog beds. My only complaint was that they would only give us 2 towels at a time and 1 wash cloth. When we walked down the hall,

The newly renovated rooms are not what I expected from a Motel 6. We got a great rate (under $60) and were pleasantly surprised with the modern room decor. It was a little strange not having carpet (pergo floors), but we got used to it. You can't beat the price and location.

Clean, big rooms. Budget-friendly. Helpful staff at the reception. Bad location, next to the freeway (noisy) and far away from everything, okay for 1- 2 nights. Extremely slow wifi, annoying when you're on vacation and want to check sights and restaurants.

We stayed two nights across a weekend, in two separate rooms, and we were very pleasantly surprised!  The rooms were better than we expected for the cost, and having WiFi, pool, and access to a laundry room thrown in was also nice.  We got there right at check-in time, so our room wasn't ready, but a cleaning lady was quick to clean it up very well.  Staff was helpful and cheerful, and for a 'roadside motel' kind of place, it was very nice.  Definitely worth the low price!

Summary Heading: Should have picked a better motel
Summary: My wife and I stayed there for two nights and were disappointed.  Our reservations were waiting and check-in was no problem.  However the first thing that greeted us in our room was no carpet on the floor.  The place was reasonably clean, but bare bones.  The big problem was a HORRIBLE smell from the bathroom.  It permeated the room and we had to close the bathroom door to escape it.  Really BAD.  It looked clean, but must have been plumbing like a bad seal between the toilet and the floor.  We complained and should have changed rooms, but it was late and we didn't.  We also had trouble with our room keys not working the second night.  I have to say the linens were clean and the beds were comfortable, but should have gone to the Ali Baba motel next door.

Summary Heading: Dirty at the End of the Summer
Summary: This Motel 6 was sufficent, basic, but very dirty outside... Dog feces all over the parking lot planters.  clear as it could be... I ignored it but it was gross... The outside was neat, painted but dirty... It needed a power washing.  My children hated the place and requested to go back to a "better" place..The inside was clean but not decorated homely.  The beds were basic and hard.. but what do you want for a Motel 6.  I told my son..okay we will go elsewhere tommorrow night...

This motel is easy to locate, right on Newport Blvd.  However, it actually is in Costa Mesa, not Newport.  Close to restaurants, with a good little place right next door.  We had a large, clean room.  It is bare bones, no shampoo, coffee maker, breakfast, etc.  However, the room had a microwave and fridge.  I stopped staying at Motel 6s years ago, but due to good ratings, tried this one.  Not disappointed.  We went back and stayed again.

This is the best motel 6 that I have seen! Very clean. It is in a quiet neighborhood. It is near the airport. It is very updated. Nice tv and bathroom. Linens were very nice.  Front desk guy was patient when I had a problem with the key.  The bad: Internet didn't work. Nothing is very close.   If the Internet worked I would highly recommend this place.

Summary Heading: Wow! Motel 6 right up the street from where the Duke used to hang.
Summary: We drove up from Carlsbad for a Friday night family get together and rather than driving back that night we decided to stay close to Balboa/Newport/Lido Isle to take a walk down memory lane when we were kids vacationing on Balboa.  This Motel 6 is one of the refurbed in the way of European efficiency units at Paris CDG.  They have done a good job and the rooms are above average in size.  We found a French bistro just down the road in Newport and had brunch on the water overlooking Lido Isle back of Villa Nova on Sunday morning.  Pool, Jacuzzi, flat panel tv and wifi..walking distance to the Orange County Fairgrounds too.

I found a great deal here via Orbitz. When I arrived, the very polished manager, MAC, offered me a free room upgrade as well. YAY! The newly remodeled hotel is very Euro-deco--loved the lines and colors-- and my room 341 was spacious...I could even do yoga. Everything was spotless. I had both a fridge and microwave.  Then there were laundry facilities, underground parking (shade) and a pool with hot tub. Generally quiet at night, too. Strategic location for my class in Corona del Mar. Thanks, Mr. Mgr. MAC, for being so gracious. I would stay here again.

The manager and staff have been very gracious and friendly. After a long trip on the road from Wilmington North Carolina it's nice to be treated so nice. We will defenetly recommend them to friends and family.

Summary Heading: Check out after 10 minutes - insects on mattress - dirty room -(no refund beware!)
Summary: We checked in at 3,00 pm but after finding an insect in the mattress (it seemed bedbugs to us) we brought it to the front desk and we were ready for checking out. The manager said it was a butterfly (?) and quickly threw it in the thrash, suggesting a different room. We said no thanks, we' re leaving, but he refused to refund us, even if we showed evidence of a dirty mattress. In my opinion you should avoid this place!!! August 2012. Cris from Italy.

Nicely decorated but it had a septic smell and the floor we coming up I'm sure from pet pee...it smelled like urine!! Was close to beach for price, and maybe it was just that certain room I got but it was horribly stinky!! Wifi is slow and hdmi didn't work, no shampoo or conditioner but did have mini fridge and microwave! Would not stay here again, I will pay $30 more for better hotel...but hey, this is the Motel 6 not the 4 seasons!!

Though I thought the rooms were nice and clean, the pool was a mess and it seems like no one picks up after their dogs because the grounds had dog poo all over.  No shampoo or conditioner as they said in earlier posts.    The real problem that I have is that when I got home, I realized I had left a bag of things that included my prescription glasses, a nice bracelet, and an unopened game for my DS.  When I called the hotel, the cleaning staff had not turned it in which is the same thing as stealing in my mind.  I'd watch your stuff closely because the next progression may be stealing out of your room while you're there.

We stayed here one night and left labor Day. No amenities - shampoo, coffemaker, dresser?. Wife felt she was in a prison cell. I though it was ok, bed was comfortable, flat screen tv. Would rather spend $20.00 more and get a dresser, coffee maker, and maybe a small breakfast.

I chose this hotel because it was close to the O.C. Fair. Newly remolded and very nice. Some issues though for the handicapped room. The shower is nice, has a seat and easy to use but the way the have the curtain it does not keep the water in the shower so you have the issue of possibly slipping and falling. Plus the water pressure is not that great. Had to sit there for 10 minutes to get conditioner out of my hair. Second issue was pricing. I booked the hotel a few months back and I had a coupon for a free night stay. The front desk person took out my reservation and re did it so the first night was free but charged me higher prices for the next two nights. I said something to the night person but nothing was done. Be careful if they claim they have to change your reservation.

This is way nicer than any Motel6 I've stayed at. Pool and jacuzzi, laundry, my room was in a quiet hallway (hint: ask for a room in the back), an has been recently tastefully redecorated. Just the Internet is a little slow.

Summary Heading: For the price good place to stay
Summary: This was a good place to stay for the price, very clean and looks newly renovated. For a Motel 6 I was very surprised. It also has easy acess to Newport and Huntington Beach. I woud've rate it higher but the customer service was bad. Had some issues regarding the room and couldn't get anyone on the phone and when I did was blown off by the by front desk staff. The WYFY was terrible too.  Couldn't get online at all.

surprisingly clean and modern for a motel, did have a odd smell in room wasn't sure if it was cleaning spray or mould  if you do not have a car and want to travel to the beach and LA area i wouldn't suggest staying here as we discovered that LA was a 4 hour bus trip or a $110 shuttle ride! But otherwise its probably one of the nicest motels you could ever come across!

Summary Heading: Helpful and friendly staff, good location
Summary: Wonderful stay, all staff were extremely helpful and friendly. Really good value compared to local hotels, and good location, only 10 mins from all local beaches and shops. Rooms were modern and clean with good facilities, microwave and fridge, air conditioning and free wifi, which has been invaluable.

Summary Heading: Clean, convenient, affordable, and VERY dog friendly
Summary: My husband and I were looking for a dog friendly hotel in Orange County that was close to the beaches and dog friendly. Motel 6 has the lowest pet fee we could find... it's free!  From the outside the hotel looks a little rundown and outdated. But the inside got a modern, minimalist makeover. They got the idea right- if you are a budget hotel the renovations must be simple. And it works. Nice inviting colors, laminate floors (PERFECT for pets- in case they have a little accident), flat screen TV. The room was tiny though. Barely had room for the full size bed my husband and I were sharing. And it felt muggy in the room even with the window unit air conditioner on. The bathroom could use a little renovation. The microwave and fridge are great especially if you want to save some

I stayed here for 2 nights, the room was new! I mean really new! No carpet on the floor instead you have wood that smells pretty good, you can tell that it's clean, smells clean. The decor was unexpectedly above average with flat screen and a beautiful bathroom. There is an elevator and lot's of parking.  Some people talk about the poor location, well for me it worked very well because it's just near the highway where I could go everywhere and it felt very good at the end of the day coming out of the highway and having my bed just there! Very cheap and you get the equivalent of a 4 star hotel!! The best motel i have been so far!

We stayed during the week so we didnt experience the loud noise that some revewers did. They have free wifi and cable with more than 5 channels, unlike big chain hotels. The room was very clean, the staff was very friendly and the location good. I like the modern look these rooms have.

Staff was very friendly! The rooms look awesome!!  The decor and the hardwood floors look great. Plus it was CLEAN!! I have stayed at a Motel 6 before and by far this is the best one. I usually do not like to stay at Motel 6 just because the ones I have stayed in before were not clean and comfortable. But I will definitely stay here again on my next visit.

Summary Heading: Not great location but good value and very good rooms
Summary: Pleasently suprised with rooms. Buses were frequent enough if u planned ahead. Staff werent overly helpful but great price

The first thing you will notice when you get to your room is the decor.  Different from standard Motel 6.  New wood floors make the room seem cleaner.  The furniture seems to be modern Swedish box store inspired.  Flat screen TV and Wifi.  Microwaves and fridge in room.  4 floors w/elevator and parking structure.  Neighborhood is nothing to write home about.

This motel was clean, quiet and in a good location, close to everything but the beds were so hard we were not able to stay our second night.  Maybe if you brought some type of cushion for the  bed it may be acceptable.  They were also pretty small.  Some of the staff was also not very friendly.  Asked for extra towels for our extra person, originally only had 2 people on resssie, and when we came back from the beach they were still not there and front desk said I needed to pick them up myself.

Summary Heading: I know you are going to say why write about a motel 6
Summary: Ihave stayed in over 30 Motel ^ around America over the last 5 years and I would normally write a review about them but this one feel I need to. I travel to California about 4 times a year and stay in Newport Motel 6 all the time  It is newly renovated to their new format with a modern interior flat screen TV, new bathrooms, very comfortable beds and a very good pool and spa complex. If you are in the area and want and very well priced place to stay central to all the surrounding shopping and beaches this is well worth the time and effort

Summary Heading: A little better than your "run of mill" Motel 6
Summary: Rooms seemed somehow cleaner because of the laminate floors in my room, and the decor was rather Euro-hotel, which is fine, since the room was extremely small, although with an effective use of the space. So, leave your bar bells or yoga mat in the trunk.  My own 6'5" frame realized that there is not a lot of room to stretch out. The sole minor complaint that I have is the crazy maze to my car from the 2 story room, which required me to walk around the lobby through a small garden and then up 2 flights of stairs, although I could actually see my car from my room's window directly below.  Great location; there's a smaller Stater Brothers grocery store nearby, and Beach Blvd with all of the shopping and restaurants is a few streets over.  Irvine biz center very close as is the

We almost drove past this when we saw that it was located next to a cheesy hotel (Alibaba) that conjures up images of cheap, party motel. But the rooms where, as stated here, un-Motel 6 like: hip, with stylish fixtures, laminate floors and nice lighting. The staff were friendly enough, and we were happy to find a place where our dogs could stay without an exorbitant pet fee. The location is decent and convenient enough: I walked a few blocks to pick up some Thai food one night, and there's a sub/pizza place right next door. Bring your own shampoo and breakfast (I had to chuckle at one of the only negative reviews that harped on this!).

Summary Heading: Amazing All round and great location
Summary: This is one of the best Motel's I've ever stayed in and I'm a frequent traveler.  The location of this motel is one of the best in OC, you are minutes from OC airport, Irvine and beach, very safe hotel and friendly staff, Tons of restaurants and shops 2 blocks down.  Stayed for 3 nights, the place was super clean, the laminate floors in the rooms help keep the rooms smell clean and fresh unlike carpet. The decor was simple and relaxing to the eye and the energy saver day light bulbs are great.  Basic cable TV with flat screen, free internet but slow in the evening due to overload, can't stream videos but it's fine during morning hours and early afternoon.  I arrived early for check in time and was immediately upgraded to a king bed room free of charge so not to make me wait for

Upon check in the staff was extremely friendly and told us of all the local attractions around and the near by restaurants. When we went in the rooms they were very big and spacious. we were very pleased. We had a very pleasurable stay here.

Summary Heading: Great hotel, loved our stay here
Summary: Only stayed here for 2 nights. We had our own hire car so the location was fine for us. It's not really close to anything walking distance but if you have a car it's great. The receptionist was so nice to us and really helpful, he gave us a 10% discount for being foreigners!  The room was really spacious, massive comfy bed, TV with cable, little fridge, freezer and microwave which was handy. Laundry to use at the hotel aswell oh and a nice pool area (not that we used it). There were smoking and non smoking rooms.  No negatives about this hotel. Great for the price.

Motel6 Newport beach Costa Mesa features all new rooms in the design of a much more expensive high class hotel with double the charge$. You will notice the kindness of the staff in the lobby right from the start of your stay. Very helpfull assistance, if you have to get something done which you cannot accomplish alone. All the most beautiful beaches are within reach of a few minutes-ride. Fully recommended! Many recreational options, e.g. Disneyland or whatch the whales from Newport beachs fish trailors..

We have stayed at about 30 different motel six's and the staff at the Newport Blvd hotel was rude as hell. Our puppy had an accident and we requested new bedding, was just wanting bedding to make the bed myself. The staff member ranted and raved about us training our puppy and came back and forth to the room several times, then the manger called the room and then came back to the room to yell at me, and hand me a copy of the pet policy and told me that he was going to charge me for the bedding, it was a pug puppy so not as if it was a huge mess. We left early. Nice pool and hot tub, but was locked. Noisy at night was woken up at 3 am to porno noises in the next room. Family friendly???? Pet friendly???

Summary Heading: Nice large room but thin walls
Summary: Just had 1 night here on way from LA. Supermarket 3 blocks away. micro wave and fridge in room. Good room but could hear next doors tv. OK stop over

We were a little skeptical due to the low price of our hotel room. We decided to go for it and booked a room with a queen bed. We are very happy we chose this place. The front desk attendant was very friendly. Upon walking into our room, we were pleased with the high level of cleanliness. The room is simple, but the upgrades to the room were well done. Flat screen tv, hardwood laminate floors, comfy bed. In addition, the location in Costa Mesa/Newport is fantastic. There is beautiful hiking along Upper Newport Bay less than one mile from the hotel. A very short drive toward the beach will take you to some great spots for food and entertainment. And the beach itself is within three miles. So the final summary is simple, clean, great location, great price.

As I noted in my first review of this motel, laminate flooring makes this Motel 6 a cut above. You can tell it is clean. We use hand towels as "bed mats" to insure our feet are clean getting into bed.  At our last visit, we paid $55.00 for Christmas eve/day.  This is not a resort.  You are 2-3 miles from the beach.  The motel itself is clean (hallways, elevators, etc.).  Remember, this is a Motel 6 and some things are "quirky."  Room numbers are not traditional, we were in room 30x and it was on the 2nd floor, not 3rd.  We were upgraded to a king room with frige and micro wave (no additional charge).  Free parking. Well lit. Once again, we will return, although beds should be replaced!

Omg! Motel 6's anywhere else are so run down and dirty. In California it was sooooo nice! For the price it was a steal-we just needed a quick 2 day stay so it was perfect. Hard wood floors-loved it. Our own fridge--perfect we had cokes and food with us, Flat screen tv-great! Big mirror with vanity lights-wish I had that at my home! Plus the room was big and I liked how the sink was detached from the shower and toilet room. Other places have them together and while my fiancé showered I could put on my makeup. Only concern-no drawers?? Just a closet with a few hangers. But it was ok with us.b

Summary Heading: A 4 star Motel 6 is an oxymoron!
Summary: While looking for a more reasonable place to spend a night in OC, I saw the reviews for this Costa Mesa Motel 6.  The location was good and the reviews were encouraging. For the price, I had no problem with the decor of the room.  And actually, it was almost identical to the rooms in the Ibis chain in France.  The mattress was very good.  However there were no niceties, no extra blanket (in fact, no blanket at all!), and we could hear the showers and TVs in rooms next door and one floor above.  The outside temps were cool and we had to turn on the heater, then get up during the night and turn it off, then on again, etc.  While the room was clean, the exterior walkways were not, with many cigarette butts and over filled trash receptacles.  The garage and walkways need a major

Ok, this is not the typical Motel 6 you've been used to. This location has been upgraded and the modern hip rooms are really nice. For one, I loved the wooden floors (who wants to deal with stinky carpets) and the rooms were really clean and came with a fridge and a microwave. They even have free WiFi with strong reliable connection and the flat screen TV was pretty neat too.  Front-desk staff was really friendly and I felt very safe staying here.  That said, the walls are pretty thin and you can hear the TV from the other room..also, parking can be hard to find if you get in late and you need to get your own shampoo/hair dryer.   If I was in the area, I would definitely stay here again.

wow! i am truly shocked at how hip the motel 6 chain has just become. i've stayed in other motel 6's in LA when i'm on movie shoots - just to sleep at someplace safe and clean. i usually go for the more stylish upscale when i spend anytime in the place. well i can say i loved staying here, i will be back as my new schedule is going to keep me in the area a lot. the free wifi sold me but the clean bathrooms and the sweet flatscreen with htmi jacks were great and the beds were heavenly. i was on the 3rd floor so i had a nice view as well. and the price - you cant beat it if you book on-line or walk in.
Great price, great service, clean, modern room, great location.  Will definitely go back again.

Summary Heading: Overall satisfied, despite a few problems
Summary: Our family of 4 (2 parents, 8 and 11 year old children) stayed here over Thanksgiving while visiting extended family.   Positives: The spiffy room decor was a welcome relief from that of some other places we've stayed at. Room was clean. We all really appreciated the hard surface flooring instead of carpeting. Also appreciated the fridge and microwave. Nice flat screen TV. Efficient heater, not too loud, as some can be. Convenient, safe location. We were able to park close to our room.  Needs improvement: Bathrm toilet seat was not fully connected to toilet - should've been noticed by housekeeping and fixed by maintenance before offering rm. Evening front desk staff had a slight attitude when I called and asked about more bath towels - there were 4 of us in the room and only 2

The location of this hotel was great - close to Newport Beach, close to the freeways and close to food and stores. The value was excellent: the room was clean and stylishly remodeled and the manager on duty during my check-in was one of the nicest hotel managers I've encountered. He made us feel like we were checking in to a Hilton.
Ignore any preconceived opinions of the hotel by its name. Recently remodeled in a Euro modern decor with flat screen TV.  Quiet.  Immaculate.  Superior bedding.  Will stay again

I've stayed at my fair share of hotels from both ends of the spectrum and this one disappointed.  I did my fair share of research beforehand and saw the good review for the place, however I was disappointed overall.  First off, I arrived and had to wait 10 minutes for the manager to come and check me in.  I'm not exaggerating.  I arrived and the housekeeper was cleaning the lobby and went to get him.  She came back and told me to it would be 10 minutes before anybody could check me in.  This was the first strike.  Second strike - as I was waiting, an iffy looking person who was riding his bike around the parking lot when I arrived came into the lobby and was just sitting around and using the computer.  Third strike - I looked out the lobby window and saw two people who looked

Motel 6 in Costa Mesa is definitely one of the cheapest places to stay for what you get (I did my research!), and what you get is impressive. First off the owner and reception were most welcoming and upgraded me for $18 a week extra to a larger room at the back with King size bed (I'd originally booked the cheapest room available). They phoned up shortly after I'd settled to check everything was ok. The bed was huge and quite comfy, there is free wi-fi (which doesn't lose connection like some other hotels had that I'd stayed at). Fitments are modern and sleek with fridge, microwave, flatscreen TV and room under the bed to put your bags out of the way. I would have like a little more storage space for clothes as I was staying for long than a few days, however this is a small

Summary Heading: Very GOOD place where to stay!
Summary: Place is really really good. It's been remodeled recently so everything is new and clean. Room are good designed, comfortable and of course clean. The only flaw with the room is some burns on the sheets and blankets, but I think the main fault is on the rudeness of the guests!! I wish all the motels would be like this one! The price is absolutely worth it for these standards (70$).

We stayed here during a weekend trip to visit friends in the area. We had stayed at a different Motel 6 recently so knew what to expect. The motel was very clean and everything had been recently remodeled. The rooms are very modern and sleek looking. The staff was very friendly and check in/out was a breeze. When we checked in they upgraded us to a King Room for free (which was nice because this gave us a nice view of the sunrise over the mountains from the room!) The beds are super comfortable and we slept so well while we were there (I dont ever remember hearing noise from surrounding rooms either) There was a microwave and mini fridge in the room but we didnt use these. They dont have hairdryers in the room which was a bit of an inconvenience. For the price of the motel it

The staff is incredibly helpful and accommodating every time I say here. The rooms are clean and well kept with plenty of parking that is convenient. I have been coming to this motel for nearly a year now off and on and I have no complaints. It is well worth the stay and is conveniently located to many freeways. I will continue to stay here.

Stayed 4 nights at the Motel 6 Newport and was pleasantly impressed.  Room was nice size, had a flat screen and a nice pool and spa.  Also had Laundry Facilities which came in handy.  Stay was actually Business and Pleasure, the WIFI came in handy for work and the Hotel Staff was very informative about things to do in the area. Going back in October.

Biggest complaint is that the room smelled like smoke.  Requested non-smoking and room and room smelled like smoke from the vents in other room.  Bed sheet feel ichy, not sure if it is bed bugs or the generic laundry soap they use. Floor is filthy....make sure u wear a black pair of socks walking around the floor....white socks turned black. NO hair dryer, shampoo or conditioner...bring your own.  No tissue....had to go buy some.  Could have paid the same price at another "hotel" for all the above stuff including a free breakfast.  They say lobby has free coffee, but lobby does not open until 7:00am......who sleeps in that late!

This has got to be the best hotel in the Motel 6 chain. The rooms have recently been renovated and they are spotlessly clean. The staff are very friendly and helpful. It's great value for money and not to far from the beaches.
If you are looking for a place to overnight, and do not want to pay much, this is it. In a convenient location, with wireless internet and friendly receptionists.

Summary Heading: It was everything we needed and a stones throw from Newport..
Summary: Every day the room was cleaned and we got new towels... The reception was very friendly and accommodating.  We had a hire car so the journey down to the beach every day was easy and the motel is round the corner from a supermarket so you can get everything you need there.  Also there is a TV and fridge/freezer in the room and free wi fi if you wanted it.  The rooms are really clean and everything you need and at a great price too - we would recommend this place wholeheartedly to anyone.

Summary Heading: Basic amenities - decent - needs some more work
Summary: Nice staff, attentive, friendly - rooms upgraded but around shower in particular you can see mold - where re-finish job on the tub and linings was never grouted. .    Towels need dryer softener sheets (like Bounty, etc) when washed -as they are  very rough feeling.   Heater/Air conditioner could use a working thermostat - it's either ON or OFF - you can set the temperature- but if you forget and fall asleep with the heat on - you'll wake up with it 90 in the room and heater still on....   The staff and manager are very nice - but you do get some people who come to party on the weekends who take up every parking space and force you to walk a long way from where you are parked - and they are noisy.
This is a newly renovated Motel 6 and is in a great location.  The staff was very friendly and helpful as well as accommodating.

Summary Heading: Motel 6 has gotten a great new remodel
Summary: I read other reviews of this Motel 6 and decided to try it...It is very nice indeed!  The   remodeled rooms are very modern/chic looking and I loved the "bamboo look" floors...so much nicer than carpeting. Check in was fine. The area is not the greatest but it is easy to get to the Orange Co. airport and Newport Beach from there.  It was a great value for the area.

Summary Heading: Great value; super clean; loved the room design; close to everything!
Summary: I picked this room because of the great reviews on Tripadvisor, and I was on a tight budget, but I was still a little wary because I had never stayed at a Motel 6 before.  It exceeded my expectations!  First of all, I loved the IKEA-like room with simple, sleek, clean-lined furniture.  The bed was super comfortable and the bedspread was a nice clean cotton coverlet.  Appreciated the cleanliness of the vinyl floors, as well as the micro/fridge combo.  Pool was next to parking lot but looked super clear and clean.  Felt safe there as a single traveler, although I did not walk around the neighborhood.  Only things I would mention if you book there: bring shampoo, a hairdryer, and definitely an alarm clock, since none of those is in the room.  Also, since pets are allowed, I

Summary Heading: Cheap Crash Pad with a friendly staff!
Summary: This was a great little motel! It's definitely a no frills motel, the rooms are very basic, small with minimal furniture. They do have microwaves, fridge, free wi-fi, and a decent TV (with convenient hookups for game consoles/computers if you have them).The staff was very nice, readily allowing late check out and early check in. This is an older motel, which has been remodeled, and there is both covered and uncovered parking. Pool and laundry facilities were great.  This is a great hotel for anyone looking for a cheap place to crash. Convenient to the Beach, Orange Coast College, Vanguard University, John Wayne Airport, and  20 minute drive to Disneyland and Anaheim convention center.  This is a no frills motel, so if you're looking for the Ritz, I'd skip it. But if you're

I was in a crunch to find a hotel for the night. I found this hotel through the excellent reviews in tripadvisor. They are true. I showed up close to midnight and the person working at the front desk was very courteous and helpful. I went to the room and was blown away at how nice and clean it was. Yes it was a low budget hotel and the room showed it (everything was bolted to the walls, etc). But I loved the European styling of the room. The only thing wrong was the slow Internet and the bed had a cigarette burn on the comforter. Bed was comfy and the bathroom was very clean. The room was not on a major road and it was verrrry quiet. The next morning I checked out and I told the gentleman working at the front how awesome the room was. He offered me a cup of coffee even though it

Contemporary decor, clean room and bathroom, flat screen tv plus a little refrigerator and microwave ~ you get a lot for your money here.  The 2 managers were helpful, attentive and accommodating.  I would definitely stay here again.

the value, cleanliness, friendliness and location were all 5 star! Mack made sure we were happy with the room by phoning up shortly after we checked in. the rooms were GREAT! Ikea furnished, nice big LCD TV, and the beds were ideal. Firm, slightly military in style but i slept like a rock. No carpet in the rooms just woodgrained tile floors, more motels ought to get that clue. this motel ought to be the flagship for Motel 6, its was immaculate..

Summary Heading: Clean, modern, stylish, will come back!
Summary: This was my second stay at the Motel 6 at Newport Blvd, I was again quite satisfied, a modern, stylish and clean place to stay with a good location for excursions to the L.A. area or just for beach chilling in OC.  One thing is there to improve: The WiFi is quite slow, downloading 600 kbytes of e-mails took me about 2 minutes in the evening, an upgrade for the dsl connection would really be helpful. Will stay here again!

Summary Heading: First time at a Motel 6 - Not bad! Clean but very basic rooms.
Summary: This was my first time staying at a Motel 6 and it's actually pretty good, except for some of the dark hallways and somewhat rundown exterior. Rooms were clean, remodeled with laminate wood floors, bright wall colors, platform beds and a flat screen TV on the wall (no HD channels were offered however). The bathroom has a granite counter top with a raised sink and tile flooring. Plenty of free parking and free Wi-Fi was available.  The platform bed was comfortable enough and even though the linens and pillows were clean they were VERY thin. Only soap is provided in the bathroom so be sure to bring along your own shampoo. The towels were also small and thin. The air conditioning worked well and was relatively quiet and has a "fan only" setting to help block out any outside noise.

Summary Heading: Fantastic modern design for a very low price...and pet friendly!
Summary: I booked this hotel after reading the great reviews here...they were right.  We were greeted by a very friendly man at the front counter- he even called up to our room after 5 minutes to make sure we were satisfied with our assigned room and asked if we needed anything else!!!  I was in shock!    This redesign is a WINNER.  Motel 6 has managed to create an IKEA version of the Standard Hotel for 1/5th of the price.  The wood floors were AWESOME, especially for those of us that shiver when they think of what normally lurks in hotel carpets.  The room is HUGE, has a large flat screen TV, table and chairs for breakfast, good sized empty fridge and a microwave.  Everyone I saw had a dog, probably because pets stay for FREE.  They have a pool too.  They have even partnered with a

Laminate flooring makes this Motel 6 a cut above.  You can tell it is clean.  This is not a resort & it is not 5 blocks from the beach as stated by another review. Parking lot pool is clean, kids will enjoy. Walls are thin & you can hear your neighbors. We paid less than $70 over Thanksgiving weekend, a great rate.  Wi fi is $3.00 per day. Free parking.  Well lit. We will return.

I thought being a Motel 6 this would not be an awesome choice but as we were on a budget it was the logical choice. I love the fact that it is near the freeway and a 15 minute drive from Disney Land!!!  It was perfect for our needs. The beach is only 5 blocks away and shopping in this area is Awesome!!! The rooms were so fresh and clean and the hotel area is very safe!!! The staff were great people so friendly. I would say that the next time I go to California I will be staying here.

Summary Heading: Great value near pricey Newport Beach area.
Summary: I chose this motel for my five-night stay due to the price and because it is within walking distance of a family member's house. I wasn't expecting much, but I was pleasantly surprised to find a clean and simple room, newly remodeled in a modern style, with a big-screen t.v. Don't expect lots of "amenities" -- this is a comfortable place to sleep at a budget price in a very pricey area. However, there was a fridge/microwave in the room, which I didn't expect. The floors are not carpeted, I'm happy to say - hard floors, maybe Pergo type. (Motel carpeting is something I try not to think about. Ick.) I saw underground parking towards the back of the motel, but I didn't use it or ask about it. The young desk employee who checked me in was casual but friendly. For the rest of my stay

Summary Heading: Excellent value for money and convenient for visiting Newport beach area.
Summary: Very modern extension. Easy to find, food outlets within walking distance, microwave in room. reception staff very pleasant

Made reservation online. Friendly front desk clerk. Spacious, clean, and modern rooms. Parking lot is big and free. Included wireless was acceptable. Noisy teenagers next room. Overall, great balance price vs quality.

This Motel 6 is modern and convenient with many fine shopping and eating options within driving distance.  I appreciated the digital, flat screen tv and the large King sized bed. However, I prefer carpeting on the floor and interior corridor facing rooms. I saw nothing unsafe about the neighborhood or the facility, as suggested by someone else, and the clerk was very friendly and helpful.  The free WiFi was very good and the room had a fridge.  However, you have to ask for more than minimum towells and the only toiletries were two small soap bars--not a problem for me and the owner has to scrimp somewhere to offer a low price.  Room layout did not permit sitting at built-in table while watching tv.  Hotwire gave me this for $10 off the $60 normal cost.

The rooms here are new and look very modern like you would see in a trendy hotel. Hardwood floors, modern bed and furniture. It was a shock walking into the room not knowing what to expect.  I paid around 75$ with tax for one night on a walk up rate which was a little steep for a Motel 6, but this is Newport.

This motel  used to be a hole in the wall for years However since becoming a motel 6 and being completely redone it is the nicest motel 6 by far. You dont get many extras but the rooms are clean new nice with bigscreen tv free internet  hbo and the parking is great and the location is great. I think it is family owned  The owner is very friendly and kool.  The next night i stayed at the crowne plaza in irvine and I found myself wishing i had stayed at this motel 6 again this motel will do very well as a motel 6 very smart owner and the rooms are designed very very wisely and maximize space with plenty of electrical outlets which most hotels are missing. this was designed with the understanding that people are going to travel with a laptop blue tooth and cell phone that are all

First of all, when booking this it said HOTEL not Motel.... Big difference! When we drove up we thought we were at the wrong hotel. It was right off the freeway with creepy characters lurking around. Second, I was in no way informed that people actually lived there. For example, I noticed post-it notes on the door next to my room informing the occupant "aka. jermaine" that his rent was in fact, 3 months past due. Not only did this alarm me but there were many cosmetic problems i.e. a very rusty pool that was completely empty, surrounded by broken patio chairs and a suspicious umbrella. We felt very unsafe and I for one will not stay in an establishment were I could possibly wake up on a stained mattress with a needle in my neck.... When I asked to cancel, the front desk

Summary Heading: New and Modern, Yet Needs Lots of Work
Summary: After reading the recent reviews on this newly remodeled hotel/motel, I decided to give it a try.  The price was right and it was said to be clean and newly furnished.  Well, the price was right for a quick sleep over and it was newly furnished.  It was clean in respect to everything was new.  The mattress was WONDERFUL since it  has hardly been used and the overall modern decor in the room was nice. Before I get specific, I would like to state that the price is low (I assume ) because the renovation has not been completed.  Also, if you are prepared for a few things not being perfect, you'll probably be fine here. However, our room was near a section of the hotel having carpet laid.  The dust seemed to trickle in under our door (there was a fine coating in the room).  As the

we actually changed a reservation to go check out this hotel for the modern look.   its definitely modern, no carpet (woohoo!!!!) nice colorful touches - streamline and basic.  its clean because its new.  it was not finished  however....no flooring (wood or carpet) in hallway - literally it was cement.  and believe me when i say this - there are no "extras".  the soap is about the size of a breath mint, the towels are for ken and barbie...even the toilet tissue was SO THIN it was laughable! there is no shampoo, kleenex, clock  or hair dryer - be warned!  but overall, Mack the manager was great - great location and definitely modern, which we loved.   if they finish what they started, it will be a great orange county find if they add a few more amenties and keep the pricing the
